file_content.text: Colonel, what are you doing? We're in the presence of a Sith Lord. It's our duty to aid in any way.
Captain, this Sith means to stop Darth Baras's mission. It seems you just aided an enemy.
It's not our place to judge between Sith, Colonel.
The order came directly from Darth Baras, and you don't have clearance to know more.
You've just signed a death warrant for your fellow soldiers. That's treason.
Trouble is, Kaid's men stationed in this sector will report any activity. If you're unwelcome, they'll warn him and Melicoste.
Everyone under Melicoste's command will be destroyed.
Not if they're dead.
Let me handle that dilemma.
Don't worry about that.
And what do you think that means, Captain?
Do you have any advice on how I should handle that dilemma?
What do you suggest?
Me? My lord, I... I figure the Sith run this Empire, so the rest of us are--well--fodder. We all know that.
Captain, are you telling this Sith to go out and kill fellow soldiers? That's treason.
I'm reporting you both to High Command. Darth Baras will know what has transpired here.
I cannot allow that.
You will not. [Kill Trill]
It will burn in his brain.
Let him hear.
Do what you have to, Colonel. It makes no difference to me.
I don't care.
Uh... excuse me, but... are you sure you want to do that? I mean, if High Command finds out about this....
Ah, I see. This is about the court-martial hearing you have coming up? You're going to burn for this.
Sith, you... uh, you're not going to just leave with her leveling such threats, are you? Your mission will suffer....
I'll manage. You're on your own, Captain.
Doesn't concern me.
Men, take Captain Oklart into custody.
That did not go as I'd hoped.
Time to die, Colonel.
You're right. [Kill her]
Yeaaaar!
Your decisiveness is enviable. I will cover your back, Sith. And Darth Baras will be none the wiser. You have my word.
If Kaid's commandos don't warn him, you'll surprise him in his bunker. He'll tell you where Lord Melicoste is headed.
Men, I'm assuming command of operations. First things first, dispose of Colonel Trill.
I'll save you the suffering.
You are a traitor. [Kill him]
Aggghhh!
That snake tried to use you to save his skin. I'm glad you were beyond his manipulations.
If you are intent on warring with Lord Melicoste, I'll stay out of it. However, I cannot sit idly by as Imperials are slaughtered.
But you do what you have to do, and may the stronger survive.
I seek information about a mission to break out Darth Ekkage and her assassins.
That's Lord Melicoste's mission. He and his team have been permitted to venture deep within the Belsavis prison.
I'm not leaving until you tell me everything.
I'm going to insist.
The lord will tell me if you won't.
I'll go find Melicoste.
My lord, wait. I believe it is my duty to aid in any way I can.
I do not acknowledge Darth Baras's authority. Uphold his order and die.
Now you'll suffer.
I will not betray my orders.
Stand down, Captain Oklart!
I will not. My lord, Lord Melicoste invaded the prison this morning with a squadron of commandos.
He's placed them throughout this level of the prison to cover his descent and to secure the area for his exit.
What is his destination?
Where is he going?
Does he suspect that he'll be followed?
Why is he so careful?
I don't believe so. He said that this mission is of the utmost importance. I think he's just being thorough. Or paranoid.
Melicoste will never leave Belsavis.
There will be no exit for him.
We don't know exactly where Melicoste is headed, my lord. But Lieutenant Kaid, the leader of his commandos, might.
I've got work to do here, Sith, please don't loiter.
